page.title: 09THE WATER MILL BROADTOWN.
page.content: There is a{water mill}in the garden of {'The Grange}'.The mill was used many years ago in{Elizabethan}times.The same time as the{thatched cottage}next door.It was used for milling corn in the{17th century}.The{stream}runs from the spring at the top of the{hill.Mr {Bourton}filled it in & it used to run to a{mill pond}where{Mrs Hudd's}house now stands in{Yew Tree}close.It eventually runs into the Avon. The owner has been up it a considerable amount of times it was {originally}used for{milling}corn.Later on the mill was used for{storage}for the{brewery.}The name of the brewery was{Hart}& Co.150 years later the main construction deteriorated considerably the bottom part is made of{limestone}& the top part is made of{brick}which was put on later.
